title: Lydney Harbour Walks

images.caption: The Picnic site and stone circle. A nice place for a rest on the route.

description: Enjoy a walk along the Lydney Canal and Lydney Harbour on this delightful waterside stroll in Gloucestershire. There's nice views over the River Severn towards Sharpness on the opposite side and the two Severn Bridges further down. It's an idyllic spot with well marked footpaths and lots of birdlife to look out for on the water. The walk starts from Lydney Train Station on the Dean Forest Heritage Railway. You can catch the old steam train from Lydney Town and then pick up the footpath along the canal to the harbour. It's a pleasant waterside stroll with lovely views across Saniger Sands on the Severn towards the end of the walk. To extend your walking in the area you can head to the Lydney Park Estate where there are beautiful gardens, woodland trails and a fascinating Roman temple. Lydney is also located near to the Forest of Dean where there are miles of nice cycling and walking trails to try. The Devil's Pulpit and the Coleford Milkwall and Parkend railway path are two highlights of the area and located not far from Lydney.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: At the eastern end of the walk there's Hips Harbourside for some refreshment. The family run coffee shop and eatery serving carefully sourced coffee and delicious cakes. There are also good quality main meals and a good selection of drinks. The cafe is positioned in a great location with fine views over the estuary. You can find them at postcode GL15 4ER for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The area is popular with dog walkers so you will probably meet other owners on a fine day.

display_address: Station Road, Tutnalls, Lydney, Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire, England, GL15 5EQ, United Kingdom
